availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Lathrop (St. Louis, Missouri, bond agent)

body.p: St. Louis, Missouri, bond agent. Massachusetts native. Marries to Ada A. Lathrop. Father of Mary Lathrop, Adelia Lathrop, Lillia Lathrop, Carra Lathrop, Joseph Lathrop, Sarah Grace Lathrop, and Willie Lathrop. Merchant in Northampton, Massachusetts, in 1860. Bond agent in St. Louis in 1863.

bibl.p: Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Missouri, District 1, Volume 3, April 1865 (Accessed via ancestry.com); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Massachusetts, Hampshire, Northampton, p. 158; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Missouri, St. Louis, ward 5, p. 132; St. Louis, Missouri, City Director, 1864, Edward, Greenough, & Deved, pub. (St. Louis: Edwards, Greenough, & Deved, 1864), p. 350 (accessed via Ancestry.com); Missouri Death Records. Jefferson City, MO, USA: Missouri State Archives. Microfilm, Missouri, St. Louis, p. 323 (Accessed via Ancestry.com).
